intro: Tecoma hypodictyon, commonly known as the yellow trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its bark is smooth and greyish. Tecoma hypodictyon is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savannas and woodland areas.
